page.title: 14Traffic, Rangeworthy
page.content:
{This is a continuation of Page 13
{The traffic survey}showed that mostly cars used the main road. There were more vans than lorries. Other vehicles made up only a small proportion of the traffic. {Some local people}are very concerned about the level of traffic. They are concerned about the speed of cars going through the village and the number of heavy lorries which cause the most noise and damage. This problem has become worse in the last year since new distribution depots have opened at Yate. {An action group}has been together with the people of Cromhall. The group is pressing for a number of improvements: a speed limit, a by-pass or rerouting of heavy vehicles.
